alert.note: Alert for Luna (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued February 22 at 11:13AM MST until February 22 at 4:15PM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... South central Luna County in southwestern New Mexico... * Until 415 PM MST. * At 1113 AM MST, an area of blowing dust was between Deming and Sunshine. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with damaging winds in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Emergency Management reported near zero visibility near Sunshine. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 77 and 91. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Deming, Sunshine, Rock Hound State Park and Spring Canyon State Park. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
